summary: Charlotte Kan introduces the AI for Good Global Summit 2018 and interviews Francesca Bria about the role of cities in democratizing AI and data, with a focus on the Barcelona City Council and the Decode Project.

The scene then shifts to a woman in a white blazer and blue dress, identified as Charlotte Kan, a journalist, speaking in front of the same graphic backdrop. events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip consists of one speaker, who appears to be female, speaking about a "privacy enhancing, rights preserving, decentralized data infrastructure." She continues, stating, "we want to democratize data, and get the citizens to be the one that decide, what kind of data I want to keep private, what kind of data I want to share, when, with whom, and on what rules." She speaks in an informative tone. She mentions using "distributed ledger technologies or so-called blockchain, with a layer of attributes-based cryptography," clarifying that this means encryption, and that data can be anonymous and not linked to identity.

events_list.audio_caption: A female speaker discusses the "Decidim Barcelona" platform, highlighting its privacy-enhancing features and its use in signing petitions and participatory budgeting. events_list.audio_caption: An adult female speaker with a professional tone discusses a "decode project" related to IoT citizen sensing in collaboration with "Smart Citizen," where citizens measure noise and air quality.
